intro: Calceolaria cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's slipper orchid, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and the species is noted for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
